On 10/19/05, Eugene Kuleshov <eu@...> wrote:
>    Robert, in Eclipse v=
ersions from 2.x to 3.2 test case that I've
> posted here give you an error=
 "unable to find test method" or
> something like that. About 50% of its te=
stcases fail all the time, so
> you have quite good choice there.

Okay, st=
ep by step instructions:

1) Run the suite first, to generate the test inst=
ances.
2) Using the JUnit hierarchy or failures tab, locate the test you wa=
nt
to re-run.
3) Right-click on it. Select "Run" or "Debug" from the contex=
t menu to
re-run it.

Note that if you double-click on it, you get the foll=
owing error:
"Method '<whatever>' not found. Opening the test class". This =
is
because double-click attempts to open the test, not run it.

> I'd be ve=
ry surprised if your Eclipse give you different result and
> very much woul=
d like to learn how did you do that. :-)

I did nothing special. Oh, the ab=
ove was for Eclipse 3.1, though it
definitely worked in 3.0 as well (I only=
 upgraded last week). Dunno
about 2.

NB: If you use the Continuous Testing=
 plugin, you have to tell it to
leave JUnit running. And it gives you a nic=
e little dialog warning
message to let you know if you try.

(Sorry for the=
 delay in responding... wanted to get back into work to
verify the exact st=
eps)
